What is currently a priority and I feel there is a gap - building and launching capital ships.

Theres "Damkina" class mothership, which needs to be powerful enough to fly to Laythe with crew and cargo (I kinda like radial attachment points like on Temstars Olympus OPD II which are working - with minor tweaks, IÃ‚Â´ve put docking ports so they can "pull" cargo as a trailer for some ships). I personaly have no experience of building such large vessel, but it is ascent stage which bothers me most.

And of course "Marduk" the light cruiser, which would even more complicated. IÃ‚Â´ve been trying out Macey DeanÃ‚Â´s "Dreadnought" class with some succes. Main problem is, that it cannot reach Laythe, not even on a good day, other problem is, that when you expend your ammunition it is useles and you may as well deorbit the whole thing. I think, that "Marduk" should be armed with at least 2-4 missiles made of SRBs facing forward. To make them reloadable missiles will be equiped with docking ports on both ends, so they can be docked by light service craft on to the hard points of the ship. What I find very good is the "Smart Missile System" very light - RCS tank, flat probe body, linear RCS port and docking port and yet it can devastate smaller craft - ideal for defense of a space station or capital ship. As far as armor goes - it is almost useles, because it can be destroyed by simple missile made of nosecone and sepratrons. Armor realy protects only againts smaller projectiles, so "Marduk" class light cruiser should have armor only on vital areas to keep parts and weight down.
Weapons, i'm out! Good luck!

Wow, this is really cool. I could *totally* see something like this further down the development pipeline as an alternative "Epic" career mode where you build ships to meet the requirements, and then use them in practice to achieve an ultimate goal. The whole idea would be to do exactly like Project BABYLON: Give players a general direction with some nice stepping stones along the way to achieve some "simple", difficult goals! Really awesome!
I'm in, on the other hand. I've made anti-fighter and anti-ship probe-base missiles, fown by the dozen up to orbit. Shouldn't be too difficult to design a working cruiser.
So, i am recruited, or not? i am expert at building colony pieces.

Welcome aboard.

I have designed a Calf class tanker, capable of holding twice the required and with loadsa Dv. I also designed an ammo transition system for torps, with decoupler cannons you need two ships right next to each other to fix the parent/child relationship problems KSP has - this makes for 2 docks instead of 1 to reload - is this alright? EDIT2:

This is my cannon system. It works like so: It begins attached to the fueselage like so. It is transfered from the 'carrier' (what it is attached to) to the 'loader' via the docking port on the front. It will now be the right way around. The 'carrier' detaches and moves away, and the 'loader' transfers it to the cruiser. The cruiser fires the docking port 'cap' off, and it is ready. When the clip is spent, the docking port is jettisoned and reloads can proceed again.
